channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report I-2023060134
item.description:
Report I-2023060134

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: Kansas City
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: YRC INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading the trailer, one battery was punctured by the forklift operator. The release was properly managed. The damaged battery was placed into a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2023060401
item.description:
Report E-2023060401

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 1, 2023, four (4) 25-pound bags of calcium hypochlorite tablets were punctured and released approximately one third (1/3) of a pound of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the site. ER personnel deployed clay absorbents and swept them in using hand tools. The crew collected all spent absorbents in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged bags in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal

item.title: Report X-2023060671
item.description:
Report X-2023060671

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-04
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO PD1 FOR A LEAKING CORROSIVE HAZMAT. RESPONDER SHOWED UP WITH PPE ON AND SPILL CART. UTILIZING DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL. LEAKING PACKAGE AND CONTAMINATED DEBRIS WERE PLACED INTO SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING THE ADMIN PLACED THE PACKAGE INSIDE A LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT IT TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: THE 2.5 GALLON OF CHLORPYRIFOS 4E HAD THE LID COME LOOSE CAUSING IT TO SPILL OUT INTO THE PACKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: EVERYTHING WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023060597
item.description:
Report X-2023060597

  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON THE LOADING DOCK LEAKING. THE ADMIN PLACED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT IT TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: THE LID HAD COME LOOSE CAUSING IT TO SPILL OUT INTO THE PACKAGE. IT WAS ALSO NOTED THAT THIS IS AN ENVIRONMENTAL HAZMAT THAT DID NOT HAVE A CLASS 9 LABEL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: EVERYTHING WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING.

DescribePack: One of the four containers of Chlorinating Solution developed a split in its body on the seam near the cap. item.title: Report E-2023060441
item.description:
Report E-2023060441

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 25, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon container of paint was damaged during transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works (EW) to remediate the impacted site. EW personnel overpacked the damaged container of paint in one (1) 55-gallondrum as waste. The crew then utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to collect the rest of the released material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that one case of printing ink (un1210) had been crushed in transit and that 2 of the inner 750 ml cartridges had been damaged and had released 0.5 cups of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND WET THE ADMIN PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: ALL THE BOTTLES HAD THEIR LIDS LOOSE. THE SDS STATES IT'S A CLASS 3 HAZMAT. THERE ARE NO MARKINGS ON THE PACKAGE TO INDICATE IT WAS A HAZMAT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: EVERYTHING WAS PLACED IN A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023060245
item.description:
Report X-2023060245

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-22
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING IN CENTRAL. THE OUTER BOX HAD NO MARKINGS AND THERE WAS AN ODOR COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. THE ADMIN PLACED THE UNMARKED BOX IN A LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT IT TO THE HAZ CAGE. DescribePack: THE ITEMS WERE IN ANOTHER BOX IN A PLASTIC BAG IN THE PACKAGE WHICH IT HAD SOAKED THROUGH. AFTER LOOKING UP THE SDS IT WAS FOUND THAT THE ITEMS ARE A CLASS 8 HAZMAT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: EVERYTHING WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023051334
item.description:
Report X-2023051334

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO ICE FORMING ON THE OUTER BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY THREE TO FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING CHEESE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. OUTER BOX IS A ULINE INSULATED SHIPPERS BOX PREPRINTED AS PERISHABLE, INSULATED, AND HAS UP ARROWS. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023051313
item.description:
Report X-2023051313

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-20
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-D. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. UPON CLOSER INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 12 PLASTIC 1 PINT BOTTLES WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX 4 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE BOTTOM OF THE CARTON. RESPONDER NOTED THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report X-2023051211
item.description:
Report X-2023051211

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-22
  • City: STRAFFORD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler was moving the package from the trailer to the NC rollers and dropped the package. The package hit the corner of the rollers and it dented the lid allowing a small amount of liquid to leak out. The package was quickly recovered by QA and removed from the sort. DescribePack: When the package was dropped the corner of the rollers hit the lid through the handle holes on the side of the box denting the lid locking ring slightly enough that some liquid was able to drip out. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a containment tote, the spillage was wiped away and the lid locking ring was reset into place so that no more liquid could come out.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED ITEMS AND PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING THE UNDAMAGED ITEMS WERE REPACKED TO BE RTS.

  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A STRONG SOLVENT-LIKE ODOR BY AN UNLOADER. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG SHE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 1 MINUTE A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT 1 OF 1 GLASS 4 LITER LABORATORY BOTTLE WAS CRACKED, CAUSING THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND PRIMARILY INTO THE PACKING MATERIAL AND BASE OF THE CARTON.

DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN LESS THAN 1 MINUTE A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. THE INETRNAL THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT 200 LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.

item.title: Report X-2023050680
item.description:
Report X-2023050680

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-06
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A HAZMAT SHIPPMENT WAS VISIBLY DICSCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION C, WET IN APPEARANCE, AND EMITTING A STRONG SOUR ODOR. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PACKAGE HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN TWO MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 PLATIC 1 GALLON JUGS WAS LOOSE BY ONE FULL ROTATION, CAUSING APPROXIMATELY 9 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF A CORRUGATED DIVDER AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-02
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS DICSCOVERED OUTSIDE OF DOORWAY BY A FEEDER DRIVER. HE NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR AND CONTACTED DMP. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED AND THE SPILLAGE WAS CLEANED UP. ALL MATERIALS WERE CONSOLIDATED AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT TWO OF THE CONTAINERS WERE RUPTURED AND COMPROMISED. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLE WALL FIBERBOARD BOX RATED AT A 44 LBS/INCH EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report X-2023050331

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ABF was transferring a pallet of UN3082 from one mobile platform to another. The side of a drum, very near the bottom, became punctured. OS on site advised that nearly the entire drum was empty by the time they were able to flip it. He expects they were able to save no more than 5 gallons from the d rum. The OS advised he did not have another way to clean the spill, only to keep it as contained as possible. A spill crew was dispatched to the terminal location.~

AND CANT BE SNAPPED BACK INTO PLACE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PAIL PUT IN A HAZ BAG AND TOTE.NEUTRALIZER WAS PLACED IN AREA THAT MAY HAVE SOME POWDER LEAKAGE.
